snippet: Vanishing antiques shops, reappearing Frank Lloyd Wright stained-glass windows, and newly digitized in-house publications from the archives of decorative arts institutions.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column notes many Manhattan antiques shops have closed, unable to compete with online offerings; stained glass windows from houses designed by Frank Lloyd Wright have recently proliferated on the market; several decorative arts institutions have received grants to digitize back issues of their in-house publications.
lead_paragraph: Vanishing antiques shops, reappearing Frank Lloyd Wright stained-glass windows, and newly digitized in-house publications from the archives of decorative arts institutions.

headline.main: Antiques Stores Fall to Online Offerings
headline.print_headline: Antiques Stores Fall to Online Offerings
